kulami.game.board

Class Panel

  • java.lang.Object
    • kulami.game.board.Panel
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PanelFour, PanelSix, PanelThree, PanelTwo

    public abstract class Panel
extends java.lang.Object
    A Panel object represents a panel on a Kulami board.

    The abstract class Panel is subclassed by panels of a particular size.

    Author:
    gordon

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Panel.PanelNotPlacedException
      Information about a Panel that has not been placed yet was requested.
      static class  Panel.PanelOutOfBoundsException
      There is not enough space for the Panel at the specified position.

      • Panel

        public Panel(char code)
        Construct a new Panel with a character code. The panel is not placed on the board yet.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • getPanel

        public static Panel getPanel(int size,
             char code)
        Factory method that returns a new Panel object based on its size and code.
        Parameters:
        size - 2, 3, 4, or 6
        code - 'b'...'r'
        Returns:
        a new Panel object

      • getName

        public char getName()
        Returns the panel's code.
        Returns:
        'b'...'r'

      • isPlaced

        public boolean isPlaced()
        Returns:
        true if the panel is placed on a board yet, false otherwise

      • getOrientation

        public Orientation getOrientation()
        Returns:
        the Orientation

      • getSize

        public abstract int getSize()
        Returns the size of the panel.
        Returns:
        2, 3, 4, or 6

      • placePanel

        public void placePanel(Pos corner,
              Orientation orientation)
                throws Panel.PanelOutOfBoundsException
        Place the panel on a board with its upper left corner at Pos corner and with Orientation orientation.

        If any positions would be outside the board, an exception is thrown. The method does not check, whether any other panels are at the same positions.

        Parameters:
        corner - the position of the upper left corner.
        orientation - the Orientation
        Throws:
        Panel.PanelOutOfBoundsException

      • removePanel

        public void removePanel()
        Remove the panel from its board.

      • getPositions

        public Pos[] getPositions()
                   throws Panel.PanelNotPlacedException,
                          Panel.PanelOutOfBoundsException
        Get the positions of the fields of a panel that is placed on a board.
        Returns:
        An array of positions.
        Throws:
        Panel.PanelNotPlacedException
        Panel.PanelOutOfBoundsException

        Returns:

      • canBePlaced

        private boolean canBePlaced(Pos corner,
                  Orientation orientation)
        Returns true if this Panel could be place with its upper left corner at corner and with Orientation orientation.
        Parameters:
        corner - upper left corner
        orientation - horizontal or vertical
        Returns:
        true if panel can be placed there
